column2: Position Summary                                     This position is responsible for a wide range of functions related to the (i) administration of global lease portfolio, including monthly end closing, reconciliation, and financial reporting and (ii) capital project management which includes financial close out of capital projects, month end reconciliations and reporting                         The roles require a person to manage a global real estate portfolio including the operating and capital spent with special focus on US-GAAPs. Also, the responsibility will include the financial disclosures/reporting as per SEC disclosure requirements.                                                 1. Preparation of the Recurring and Adhoc Journal Entries with minimum specification from Clients                         2. Assist with monthly financial reporting, such as booking accounting entries, and balance sheet certifications. Ensure overall governance and highlight/escalate potential issue.                           3. Assist with the analysis of current and historical financial results for Lease and Owned building within the scope of Corporate Real Estate and prepare reports/studies that will enhance the analysis.                        4 Resolve the suspense created due to intercompany accounting mismatch                             5. Assist with the implementation of new Amortization Schedules for Deferred Rent as per US GAAP                             6 Perform research relating to queries raised by State side or third-party vendors, etc. and assist with preparing timely responses                             8. Assist in analysis of Budget and its comparison with Actuals and Forecast                           9. Assist in preparation of Management reports.                         10. Review work performed by Accounts Associates and bring value addition in the process using lean and other Six sigma tools.                             Knowledge, Skills and Abilities                                       Education                             CA with at least 6-8 years of relevant experience                                            Experience                           Experience in Accounting, knowledge of GAAP/STAT accounts and closing and reporting related activities.                                 Practical knowledge of US GAAPs, IFRS and other relevant accounting guidelines.                                 Investigate         ,        resolve, and reconcile outstanding balances and items.                                           Knowledge and skills        (general and technical)                               Ensure overall control of financials as per US-GAAP and IFRS guideline with 100% accuracy       Understand the complexities involved in reporting and ensure seamless submission of certifications and disclosures to regulators     Should be proficient in handling complex financial issues     Ensure that the assigned targets are met in accordance with SLA and Internal standards     Ensure that the quality of work follows predefined parameters as defined by Process Excellence     Strong Research Analytical skill is required                               Analytical skills, with an ability to research and resolve complex problems                           Experience of handling financial as per US-GAAP and IFRS                             Experience reading and interpreting business documents and contracts                                 Co-ordination ability as process involves daily unstructured and complex interaction with state-side partners and external reinsurers.                               Strong PC skills, knowledge of Microsoft Office                               Proficiency in Communication                                  Strong interpersonal, communication and relationship building skills                                 Data gathering ability/ attention to detail                                 Ability to work in a team environment with minimal supervision                                 Ability to work successfully in fast paced, production driven environment with tight deadlines                                 Adaptable to change                                           Other Requirements            (licenses, certifications, specialized training - if required)                     Candidate should be well versed with accounting packages used in industry like Cubus, BI, People Soft, Hyperion etc                 Knowledge of Lean Principles and Six Sigma and its application in the process is preferred.

column2: Technical Accounting                       Learn about emerging accounting issues that may impact MetLife s reporting obligations under GAAP, IFRS and Statutory requirements.                     Research technical accounting issues and accounting policy/procedure matters. Interpret and project the financial impact on Operations, on a US GAAP, IFRS and a statutory basis.                     Prepare position papers presenting the Technical Accounting Group s interpretation of the accounting issues/ new product launch/ new contracts entered into by MetLife, provide application of appropriate guidance and conclusion on the accounting treatment.                     Stay abreast of new accounting changes/developments. Analyze technical pronouncements and ask questions to gain an understanding. Evaluate and effectively communicate implications for MetLife of the proposed issue. Assist with implementation of new accounting pronouncements.                     Participate in US GAAP & IFRS implementation projects having advanced level knowledge under ASC 944 (including LDTI) & IFRS 17.                     Preparation of offline/Online accounting training presentations under U.S.GAAP and IFRS to provide trainings to employees                     Ability to analyze the Financial Statements and perform concurrent reviews of MetLife s entities financial statements.                     Conversion of financial statements from Local GAAP to US GAAP                     Ensuring Quarterly and Annually SOX compliance of MetLife Operating Policies                      Strong understanding of US tax                            Customer Focus and Partnership                     Partner with various units (Financial Reporting, Expenses, etc) in order to understand the accounting issues.                 Provide timely and accurate guidance/assistance in evaluating accounting treatment/processes/procedures to various groups within the business.                 Build relationship with TAG members from other business units. Work collectively with various groups to resolve complex issues.                              Time/Project Management                     Prioritize and focus to meet customer expectations and project deadlines.                 Work under constant changing environment.                  Manage multiple tasks to ensure all deliverables are completed by due dates.

Compliance with globally standardized processes for financial reporting   Recognition of revenue in line with IFRS principles       Revenue / Cost matching in monthly management reporting   Adherence to Group Finance Policies as laid down in the Finance Manual   Assist in managing Customer accounts and maintaining up-to-date statements.   Preparation of analytical reports on Hub performance and track financial KPI                Key Accountabilities:               Financial Accounting Reporting (40%)     Ensure timely completion of reporting for the Managed Services   Support the preparation and review of all monthly Actuals reporting (PL and Balance Sheet) ensuring it is compliant with IFRS and Group accounting policies.   Ensure the completeness and accuracy of all management reporting in Hyperion       Ensure the accuracy of foreign currency accounting transactions in the system in accordance with the Group Finance Manual   Support the development of new system developments, to drive improved compliance and efficiency.   Have in-depth knowledge of the reporting systems (Hyperion Unit4Financial) to be able to advise end users on reporting requirements through the system.       Support the review of new IFRS requirements and/or regulatory issues and recommend how the business should prepare to meet them.   Support the rollout of a robust Financial Accounting and Reporting control environment that adheres to the Inchcape Group policies and embeds best practices across the business.   Ensure bank reconciliations are performed to reflect the correct position of the Global client contracts     Business partnering (20%)     Provide best-in-class technical accounting advice to the team through constant guidance and optimization of process   Support the identification and mitigation of accounting risks across the Group.   Support the business by educating and advising them on how to use the accounting systems.   Support ad hoc analysis as required by the Global teams, including Treasury, Tax, IT, Internal Audit, Legal and HR.     External Audit (20%)     Support the group audit process by providing the required documents   Support the team with guidance in preparing reconciliations and other work papers, including providing support to the Global Finance Consolidation team.     Finance team development (20%)     Be an active part of the senior finance team for Managed Services and support the Hub operations Develop the team of GL accountants into a professional, high-performing function.              Knowledge, Experience, and Skills:     Essential:     Excellent knowledge of IFRS and statutory accounting   Experience as a financial manager heading a team.   Experience in financial risk management and enforcing control environment.   Experience in working in a multi-national, multi-cultural organization.   Excellent communication skills and a good command of the English language (oral and written)   Experience in working on a group consolidation system.               Desirable: Good to have but not mandatory     Knowledge of the shipping industry   Knowledge of Hyperion Financial Management system   Knowledge of Unit4 Financial system   Experience in project management   Experience in managing a team                    Education and Professional Qualifications:       Essential:     University degree in finance, accountancy, business    Qualified and Registered Chartered Accountant (ACA /ACCA / CPA (or equivalent)           Other Requirements:Essential:     Access to hi-speed reliable internet connectivity from home (during remote working)               Why Inchcape Shipping Services                 We believe in building a diverse and high-performing workforce, that works together to provide our customers with the exceptional service they deserve. To reach the highest standards we depend on our people, their welfare, training, and expertise. We realize the value of our staff and know that your unique experiences, skills, and passions will help you to build a rich and rewarding career in our dynamic industry.                  Our values are at the centre of everything we do and the successful candidate will be expected to demonstrate and fully adopt these:                Global Perspective - we connect the world and see the bigger picture.          The Power of People - we rely on the strength of local agent knowledge and relationships.          Progress - we adopt new thinking and push for positive change in our industry.                  In return, we will offer you:                  A diverse range of benefits, depending on your geographical location. Globally as a minimum, you will receive:                    A retirement savings plan              Life assurance          Holiday starting at 22 days          Healthcare          Competitive salary          Employee Assistance Programme              Career development and progression opportunities          Values Award celebration events          Team building days                    Plus, much more!                  If you think that you have the right skills, knowledge, and attitude to join our team, then we invite you to apply by simply clicking at the top of this advert!                  #ISSthebiggerpicture                  Appointment to this role will be subject to satisfactory references and possession of a valid Right to Work documentation depending upon your geographical location.                          #LI-MB1

column1: Grants Compliance and Donor Reporting Manager
column2: The Grants Compliance and Donor Reporting Manager is responsible for leading the grant management and compliance requirements, grant financial reporting, grant audit and monitoring processes in Habitat for Humanity India to obtain reasonable assurance in compliance with donor requirements and applicable policies.      Participate in the grant management capacity assessment before proposal or applications submitted.      Review grant and subgrant agreements including financial budget, match and reporting requirements.      Participate in partner/subgrantee due diligence, review, and selection.      Track grant/donor fund utilization and provide recommendations to management including budget revisions and no cost extensions if needed.      Perform periodic offsite/on-site monitoring of grant implementation.      Ensure that the project grants are executed in a timely manner and in accordance with the grant agreement.      Monitor grant close out activities according to donor requirements and internal policies.      Coordinate and support internal audit, external audit, and grant audit including implementation of grant-related audit recommendations.      A world where everyone has a decent place to live. 2      Collaborate with the related stakeholders in developing and implementing grant-related policies, procedures, processes, and guidelines including standard proposal and budget template, cost recovery and cost allocation process to ensure compliance on donor s requirements.      Prepare and provide training and materials on grant management and compliance.      Create, maintain and monitor grant tracking tool to ensure grant reporting compliance.        Skills, Qualification, and Experience       Bachelor s Degree in Commerce or equivalent in professional experience and qualifications. 5 years experience in Grant Management Experience with budget preparation and donor reporting      Qualifications (Knowledge and Competencies): Project management skills Proficiency in English language. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong organizational skills, great leadership qualities and exceptional budgeting and monitoring skills Strong administrative skills with the ability to set priorities and manage multiple tasks under minimal      supervision in effective and efficient manner Proficiency in computer skills and Microsoft software tools like MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Sharepoint, etc.      Preferred in addition to minimum: Knowledge of and experience handling funds from major donor agencies (ex. USAID, EU, DFID) Experience working with accounting software and reporting tools especially SunSystems.

column2: Function: Accounting and Reporting Consulting (ARC) Role & Responsibilities Uniqus is seeking professionals for our ARC team. As a Manager, you will work with clients to provide high-quality accounting advisory services set out above. You will be responsible to maintain client relationships with senior stakeholders, work with Partner & Directors as well as mentor the team members apart from providing support on our business development and practice management initiatives. Responsibilities: - Participate in business development activities and contribute to proposal development. - Manage client relationships and act as a point of contact for clients. - Project management - Technical accounting advice to clients on complex accounting issues, and conduct research on accounting topics and prepare technical memos - Assist clients with the implementation of new accounting standards. - Assist clients with financial reporting, including the preparation of financial statements. - Review and analyse client financial information and provide recommendations for improvement. - Supervise and mentor team members. - Stay up to date on developments in accounting standards and regulations. - Ability to manage multiple engagements and deadlines, - Attention to detail and ability to work independently. - Apply independent and objective professional judgment in applying accounting standards to meet engagement expectations, including regulatory requirements. Requirements We're looking for accounting professionals who are passionate about providing accounting and reporting consulting to clients which includes support on technical and special matters including GAAP Conversion, accounting policy support, new accounting standard implementation (end to end), and Disclosure support for IFRS/USGAAP/Ind AS. The incumbent will work for top global clients across a wide variety of markets and industry sectors. - Strong domain, project management, business development and people skills. - Demonstrate a sound understanding of accounting concepts; stay informed of professional standards; and effectively apply this knowledge to moderately difficult and/or complex client situations. - Flexibility and willingness to travel on short notice, as necessary. - Possess strong domain knowledge. - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. - Strong written and verbal communication skills. - Ability to work under pressure - stringent deadlines and tough client conditions which may demand extended working hours. - Demonstrate integrity, values, principles, work ethic and lead by example. Qualification - Qualified CAs - CPAs/ACCAs with experience of working in technical accounting/financial reporting - 5-9 Years of relevant experience

column2: GCR GCS-Senior Tax  Global Compliance and Reporting is an integrated suite of Tax and Accounting services that EY provides to our multinational clients. GCR offers the ease of managing compliance & regulatory filings by:  Taking care of the complexity of regulatory affairs across multiple jurisdictions  Centrally managing the global compliance and reporting activities  Controlling the cost of managing compliance across various countries  Each client is referred to as an engagement and the GCS team is responsible for ensuring the delivery as per the service level agreements. Globally, tax and accounts preparation activities are conducted mostly in the local countries and hence requires a wide network of EY professionals to work together to deliver to the client expectations. A central team (GCS) works with this global network of EY professionals to ensure clients compliance and reporting obligations across the globe are met on time. The GCS team project manages the engagement and together with the client facing teams in Americas, EMEIA and Asiapac forms the service management office for the client    Job purpose:  During the Transition phase:   Support the Engagement Leader to ensure efficient and effective transition and implementation of services to EY, including interfaces with client local country contacts, shared service centers, tax/finance stakeholders and related EY network  Develop and manage transition plan, including roadmap, work plan, budget, timeframe, responsibilities and accountabilities  Ensure a good working relationship with the client, any relevant third parties (e.g., BPO provider, attest firms, etc.) and EY network, in particular their counterpart(s) in client organization.  Drive discipline and careful management of the definition of scope to ensure EY services are consistent with those agreed and any scope of services beyond agreed scope are properly considered, scoped, agreed with appropriate fees.  Monitor, control and communicate status during transition and implementation, against SLAs/KPIs, contractual requirements, service quality and financial budgets.  Ensure changes in scope are agreed between EY and Client including contractual agreement and commercial/fee implications  Successfully resolve any issues that have been escalated to them or escalate any non-resolved issue to the steering committee  Proactively consider and identify any potential additional needs, service opportunities and efficiency/service level enhancements    During Service delivery:   Support the Engagement leader to ensure the delivery of exceptional client service, day-to-day oversight and management of our global/regional service delivery.  Ensure a good working relationship with the client, relevant third parties (e.g. BPO provider, attest provider, etc.) and EY network, in particular their counterpart(s) in client organization. Key client interfaces may include global/ regional GCR, SSC, and of course Tax/Finance contacts  Execute disciplined management of in-scope services to ensure EY services are consistent with those agreed and any scope of services beyond agreed scope are properly identified, scoped and fees agreed in advance.  Monitor and report against SLAs/KPIs, contractual requirements, service quality and financial GCR budgets.  Ensure changes in scope/fee are agreed between EY and Client (and other 3rd party when appropriate)  including contractual and commercial agreement.  Successfully resolve any issues that have been escalated and further escalate any non-resolved issues to the GEL.  Manage the annual roll-over process, including any scope/fee changes, contract renewals, data refresh.  Proactively consider, identify and share with the engagement leader any potential additional needs, service opportunities and efficiency/service level enhancements  Desired skills requirements:  We are looking for candidates with the following:   Project Management  People Management  Service Delivery and operations management  Risk and issue management  Sound understanding of Finance process   Stakeholder and Budget management   Contract and SLA management   PMP Certification desired    You will need to:  Minimum 5+ years of corporate experience of which at least 1 year should be in project delivery   Have effective communication skills - both written and oral    Have formal education in Commerce/Finance    Demonstrate strong organizational skills and structured thinking abilities   Demonstrate strong interpersonal and analytical skills   Demonstrate an eye for detail   Be flexible and willing to adjust responsibilities to align with developing business needs   Be proficient in MS Project/Word/PowerPoint/Excel - working knowledge of MS office

column2: As a Senior Manager, youll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:           Encourage everyone to have a voice and invite opinion from all, including quieter members of the team.     Deal effectively with ambiguous and unstructured problems and situations.     Initiate open and candid coaching conversations at all levels.     Move easily between big picture thinking and managing relevant detail.     Anticipate stakeholder needs, and develop and discuss potential solutions, even before the stakeholder realises they are required.     Contribute technical knowledge in area of specialism.     Contribute to an environment where people and technology thrive together to accomplish more than they could apart.     Navigate the complexities of cross-border and/or diverse teams and engagements.     Initiate and lead open conversations with teams, clients and stakeholders to build trust.     Uphold the firms code of ethics and business conduct.                             Job Description           Senior Manager - AC Operations - Finance Lead         Join our AC Operations team as a Senior Manager and play a crucial role in transforming our AC finance operations     This position is ideal for a driven and experienced leader passionate about creating transparency in the costing of our AC resources     You will be at the forefront, working within a dynamic team of problem solvers focused on sustainable, outcome-oriented strategies to advance our AC operations objectives             Responsibilities:         Act as the communication bridge, conveying the financial impacts and changes to stakeholders effectively.     Engage directly with AC to anticipate and understand shifts in resource rates, deepening transparency in resource costing.     Conduct thorough reviews of reconciliations between AC invoices and budgetary expectations.     Oversee the alignment of AC resources accurately within the appropriate cost centers, ensuring standard costing practices are applied efficiently.     Analyze grade codes for accuracy and manage actual costs versus budget, providing clear explanations for variances.     Partner with the AC Operations reporting team to forecast future AC expenses and      Collaborate with the onshore finance team for precise month-end accruals of AC resources.     Collaborate with the onshore finance team to oversee the financial aspects of our AC recognition program, ensuring alignment with our strategic goals.     Collaborate coordinate with the TIF Owners and Chief Investment Officer (CIO) and onshore finance team to manage quarterly and annual reporting on our various Territory Investment Funds (TIFs).     Support the review of business cases and economic models which are submitted as part of the annual TIF approval process and bring insights and recommendations to TIF leadership to support strategic decisions.     Provide recommendations to support the improvement of the TIF process overall, including how we track and measure Return on Investment (ROI) and other relevant Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and how the TIFs are generating value for the firm.               Requirements:           A Certified Public Accountant (CPA)/ Chartered Accountant (CA) designation is recommended.       Demonstrated expertise in financial operations, with a strong focus on standard costing and budgeting.     Knowledge of the unique challenges and complexities of AC finance operations an asset.     Ability to effectively collaborate with and lead diverse teams across various geographies.     Skilled in stakeholder engagement, with a proven track record of effective communication.      Strategic and analytical thinker with robust problem-solving skills.     Comfortable analyzing financial models and understands finance and investment concepts.      Familiarity with PowerBI dashboards would be an asset.      Willingness to learn and spend the time with the onshore and AC finance teams to understand the internal workings of the PwC financial and reporting methodologies systems (eg: standard cost, operating units, Salesforce Opportunities etc.)      Exceptional communication abilities, capable of simplifying complex financial concepts for a broad audience.     A commitment to diversity and inclusion, valuing diverse perspectives and fostering an inclusive environment.     Self-motivated individual with a strong sense of initiative and a passion for collaborative work.     Outstanding multitasking and project management capabilities.

column2: Coursera s IT department is responsible for the Corporate tools and technology that are required for the company to operate efficiently and effectively. We are a growing IT department that plays an integral role in the company s ability to perform its day-to-day tasks. While supporting an ever-growing number of users with top-tier tools and applications, our IT team is always aiming to achieve the highest goals and produce the best experience possible for our end users.      As a Finance Technology Manager at Coursera, you will play a critical role as both a technical expert and a People Manager, overseeing and managing the ongoing maintenance, optimization, and strategic utilization of the Netsuite system within our organization. Your primary responsibility will be to ensure the effective utilization of Netsuite functionalities to support our Finance business processes, drive automation, and enhance data accuracy and reporting capabilities specifically tailored to Courseras needs. Leveraging your expertise in Netsuite configuration, system administration, project management, and people management, you will contribute to the continued success and evolution of the Netsuite platform at Coursera.          Responsibilities:         Evaluate Finance processes, collaborate with cross-functional teams such as the Finance, People, Enterprise Sales and IT, and implement system enhancements, workflows, and custom reports to optimize efficiency and user experience using our Finance technology systems.      Maintain data integrity and accuracy within our Finance technology systems, regularly reviewing and updating Finance data, and developing customized reports to meet Finance and management reporting needs.     Collaborate with stakeholders to identify and prioritize system enhancements and integrations aligned with Courseras strategic goals, working closely with vendors, partners, and internal teams to ensure seamless data flow and system interoperability.     Support the planning, execution, and delivery of Finance technology initiatives, adhering to timelines, budgets, and quality standards, and effectively managing project activities and stakeholders.     Provide guidance, support, and training to end-users, addressing questions, troubleshooting issues, and promoting self-service capabilities to enhance user understanding and proficiency in utilizing Finance technology functionalities effectively.     Lead a high performing team of Netsuite and Finance Technology professionals enforcing strict quality standards, documentation and continuous improvement processes to drive exceptional results and ensure effective utilization of technology solutions.         Basic Qualifications:         BSC / MSC degree in Information Systems, Information Technology, Finance or a relevant field     3+ years of experience in a people management role and developing a high performing global team      7+ years of demonstrated experience implementing, managing, and optimizing Netsuite systems in a live environment, including proficiency in Netsuite     Proficiency in system administration tasks, including configuration maintenance, security roles, and business processes, and strong analytical and problem-solving skills to translate complex requirements into practical solutions, combined with experience in Agile project management, effectively managing multiple priorities, meeting tight deadlines, and fostering cross-functional collaboration.     Strong communication and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration with stakeholders at all levels, promoting smooth interactions and understanding of business needs.         Preferred Qualifications:         Netsuite Certifications in the following areas: ERP Consultant Certification, Administrator Certification, SuiteFoundation Certification, Application Developer Certification, SuiteAnalytics User Certification     Willingness to be a hands on Finance technology systems leader to build solutions alongside a high performing team     Over 5 years of demonstrated Netsuite configuration, Development and Integration experience.Additional experience in Coupa/Workday/HighRadius will be a plus.     Over 3 years of experience in a Finance Technology leadership role.      Over 3 years in a Netsuite consultant role.     Experience leveraging ServiceNow or similar applications to intake and prioritize projects   ?

column2: Skill required:  FBM Performance and Advisory & Corporate Functions Finance - Finance Strategy Designation:  Finance Business Management Manager Qualifications: Bachelor's degree with Finance specialization  Years of Experience: 13 to 18 years  What would you do? Performance & Advisory is our new multi-dimensional finance capability that opens boundless opportunities for our people and reflects the strong culture of shared success that we aim to build. The Performance component directly reflects that success is based on business outcomes achieved; while the Advisory component represents the expected contribution further along the value chain, with shared accountability for results.P&A professionals will be equal team members on the Finance teams to which they are assigned, sharing ownership of business outcomes. Functionally aligned. Directly assigned.Within Performance & Advisory we have several towers, collaborating as needed to achieve shared outcomes and shared success:-P&A Account & Portfolio Performance -P&A Forecasting & Planning-P&A Payroll & Cost Optimization-P&A Data Analytics & Storytelling-P&A Investments-P&A Competitor Financials-P&A Integrated Delivery FinanceRole:You will be part of the Performance and Advisory Investments.Investments supports the execution of Accenture s global strategy by working closely with Corporate and Entities (i.e. Services, Markets, Corporate Functions) Finance and G&S leadership, to ensure that investments are well aligned to the firm s global strategy, producing a clear and compelling return on investment, and are being executed in an efficient and cost-effective manner.Key Responsibilities:-Understand and become an advocate of corporate's investment strategy.-Become a Champion of the processes and requirements to execute the Investment strategy.-Contribute with feedback to reinforce or improve processes, identify, and adapt best practices, stive for simplification and standardization.-Supervise and sometimes fulfill scheduled Monthly/Quarterly planning, analyzing, and advising activities to leadership regarding all Investments Categories.-Supervise and sometimes fulfill non-scheduled Monthly/Quarterly planning, analyzing, and advising activities to leadership regarding all Investments Categories.-Share insights to leadership both orally and written with compelling supporting materials.-Respond to CFO and G&S leads ad-hoc requests related with investments.-Work with stakeholders to prioritize investments among competing demands. Intervene when necessary to ensure entity meets financial and strategic objectives.-Communicate with corresponding leadership about progress, leveraging standardized global reporting.-Collaborate with others within or outside the team, as needed. -Facilitate inputs to global processes and reporting. What are we looking for? column2: Topic Advisory Senior Manager (L6) Cost Transformation Job Description At Accenture, we believe your career is about what you want to be and who you want to be. It's about bringing your skills, your curiosity and your best true self to your work. Here, you'll match your ingenuity with the latest technology to do incredible things. Together, we can create positive, long-lasting change. We are: Strategy & Consulting Global Network at Accenture empowers our people to compete, win and grow. We develop everything they need to grow their client portfolios, optimize their deals and enable their sales talent, all driven by sales intelligence. Our Topic Advisory team is a specialty sales advisory service within the Strategy & Consulting Global Network. We are specialists aligned to Accenture's priority business offerings with expertise in how to go-to-market and best position Accenture to win work. We are the sales lab that works with offering leadership, equipping them with relevant market insights, customized sales messages, and curated sales assets to originate, sell, and win. You are: A Senior Manager who is comfortable working with senior Accenture stakeholders. You have an executive presence and deep expertise in Cost Transformation / Zero Based Budgeting. You have led or supported Cost Transformation projects that have helped reduce / right size / optimize cost across the P&L. This includes experience in sourcing, process transformation, technology optimization, demand management and other cost related value levers. The work: As a Topic Advisory Senior Manager, you provide high touch sales support to our Cost Transformation teams. This will include but is not limited to the following: Planning and Origination Support annual planning to outline sales targets, target clients, and enhancement of sales assets. Conduct ongoing research to identify which companies to target over next 6-12 months. Lead sales / pipeline reviews with leaders. Prepare for and support first conversations with potential clients. Proposals / Orals Define proposal response requirements and best sales messaging approach. Bring the latest knowledge and best of content to each opportunity (e.g., industry trends benchmarking, competitive insights, etc.) Help shape the overall solution (approach, team, pricing, differentiators, etc.) to best fit the deal requirements. Prepare for and support orals with innovating ways of selling to help differentiate Accenture. Relationship Development / Stakeholder Engagement Establish yourself as critical and strategic partner for Cost Transformation / Zero Based Budgeting within the market and globally. Build and deepen relationships with Market Leadership to support origination and pursuit activities. Identify stakeholders that should be leveraging Topic Advisory for their pursuits and build awareness and credibility for your capabilities and those of Topic Advisory broadly. Content Management / Continuous Improvement Develop go-to-market approach / assets. Maintain global repository of sales assets (e.g., proposals, stage 0 decks credentials, etc.) Conduct reviews (loss / delivery) with client teams to understand how we can improve and harvest deliverables. Stay relevant through training, research, client interaction and feedback sessions. Qualification Here is what you need: Bachelor's degree in business or engineering. 7+ years functional experience in Cost Transformation. 7+ years in in sales or consulting at a top-tier consulting. English language fluency (oral and written). Must support/mirror working hours for the supported region. Must be flexible with working hours to meet shifting business needs. Must have good internet connectivity and distraction-free environment for working at home, in accordance with local guidelines. Bonus points if you have: Experience in Sales and Business Development

Support and drive the Data analytics agenda along with Global Finance partners. Modeling and analyzing data from global data platforms, identifying data analytics solutions and helping in developing output reporting platforms.        A key requirement of this position is the ability to leverage analytical experience and build relationships within the Avery Dennison organization including finance workstream leads/key project stakeholders and develop a strong mechanism to establish financial models and tracking processes which will support the organizations priorities, drive and deliver the change required by Digital Transformation programs.      Strong financial planning, analysis, and organizational skills coupled with an attention to detail are a must. Rich experience managing/interpreting/enhancing data from multiple systems to support decision-making. Partner with the PMO for system and digital transformation programs and establish financial processes and modeling which support tracking the project financials.      Responsible for partnering with the Digital PMO to manage a framework including financial modeling, investment appraisals, and establishing KPIs and performance reviews to support the progression of Digital Transformation programs in the optimal sequence.      Provide timely status updates and delivery of metrics to leadership, in partnership with the PMO and other transformation partners, driving the operational level financial and project reporting through the governance model.      Provide key financial updates and metrics to the Digital PMO leadership team, strategic program-level leaders and project steering committees. column1: Senior Finance Leader To Drive Strategic Financial Management
column2: Role Summary:   The Senior Finance Leader will provide strategic leadership and oversight across all aspects of our accounting and finance functions. This pivotal role encompasses managing our finance team, liaising with external consultants, and ensuring timely information flow for effective decision-making. Key Responsibilities: Strategic Financial Leadership:  Direct and govern the finance department, including accounts receivable (AR) and accounts payable (AP). Team Management:  Lead the finance team with a focus on optimising team performance and productivity. External Collaboration:  Coordinate and communicate effectively with external consultants to facilitate advisory and transaction execution projects. Financial Planning and Analysis:  Conduct thorough financial analyses to bolster transaction execution and provide strategic advisory services. column2: GCS - Senior  Global Compliance and Reporting is an integrated suite of Tax and Accounting services that EY provides to our multinational clients. GCR offers the ease of managing compliance& regulatory filings by:    Taking care of the complexity of regulatory affairs across multiple jurisdictions   Centrally managing the global compliance and reporting activities  Controlling the cost of managing compliance across various countries    Globally, tax and accounts preparation activities are conducted mostly in the local countries and hence requires a wide network of EY professionals to work together to deliver to the client expectations. The project management professional will be part of the service management function of the engagement governing the delivery of the global engagement while working closely with EY engagement leadership, client and any relevant third party providers (where applicable) to provide visibility and control over data and filings worldwide.     Job purpose:    The job holder will work on a number of client accounts/ engagements, where they will be involved in delivering all service management aspects of a multi- national GCR engagement.     Key responsibilities:    Implementation phase  Post the awarding of the contract to EY, there is a detailed project phase where the GCR business model needs to be implemented across the countries in scope. This involves extensive collaboration with EY professionals across various functions and countries, local client entities, central client team and possibly 3rd party service providers. Main tasks for the GLOBAL SERVICES professional in this phase would include:    Knowledge transfer:   Communicate new client win and identify EY professionals across network who will be part of the delivery  Project manage local knowledge transfer meetings across multiple functions and countries to capture specific scope of service  Technology set-up:   Assess outcomes of knowledge transfer meetings to build the delivery plan for the next year  Build project plan for delivery and set up engagement management tools  Contractual:   Identify changes in scope post local knowledge transfer meetings and build up fee schedule for central client negotiations  Issue sub contracts to local EY teams for agreed scope and fees to initiate service delivery    Service delivery phase  During service delivery, local EY teams will prepare tax and accounting compliance deliverables to help the client entities meet the jurisdictional requirements in the respective countries. Main tasks for the GLOBAL SERVICES professional in this phase would include:    Service management:   Monitor the compliance delivery services across multiple countries and functions   Prepare reports indicating status, issues and potential risks in delivery for the respective period  Coordinate with local EY teams to work through issue resolutions  Change management:   Coordinate with local EY teams to understand nature and impact of scope change  Prepare detailed change requisitions for regional and global client approvals  Invoice and cash flow:   Maintain schedules of inter-EY and client billings  Work with finance teams to raise necessary invoices and track invoices raised by local EY teams  Coordinate with various stakeholders for clarifications on invoicing and contract related issues and queries        Desired skills:  Strong organization and project coordination capabilities  Good analytical, judgment, tact and decision-making ability along with critical thinking skills  Excellent written, oral and presentation communication and stakeholder engagement skills   Ability to work in a multi-functional, multi-geographic team  Ability to build and maintain excellent relationships across organization levels   Ability to work and team with a multitude of different people and different cultures    Desired experiences:    At least 4 years of working with major global corporation (Big 4, Finance shared services, etc.) with atleast one year in project delivery or engagement/ account management   Have formal education in commerce/ finance  Knowledgeable in finance processes and be able to deal with large volume of data  Proficient on MS Project/ Word/ Excel/ Power Point   Working knowledge of MS SharePoint  PMP certification and client facing experience desired

column2: Job Description   Title:  Transition Manager  Reporting To:  Service Manager, Global Finance Shared Services   Location:  Bangalore, India  RWS   RWS Holdings plc is a unique, world-leading provider of technology-enabled language, content, and intellectual property services. Through content transformation and multilingual data analysis, our unique combination of technology and cultural expertise helps our clients to grow by ensuring they are understood anywhere, in any language.  Our purpose is unlocking global understanding. By combining cultural understanding, client understanding and technical understanding, our services and technology assist our clients to acquire and retain customers, deliver engaging user experiences, maintain compliance, and gain actionable insights into their data and content.  We work with over 80% of the worlds top 100 brands, more than three-quarters of Fortune?? 20 ??ost Admired Companies??and almost all of the top pharmaceutical companies, investment banks, law firms and patent filers. Our client base spans Europe, Asia Pacific and North and South America. Our 65+ global locations across five continents service clients in the automotive, chemical, financial, legal, medical, pharmaceutical, technology and telecommunications sectors.  Founded in 1958, RWS is headquartered in the UK and publicly listed on AIM, the London Stock Exchange regulated market (RWS.L).  For further information, please visit:  RWS   About Group Finance   In joining RWS?? Finance team you will be a critical part of supporting a listed world-leading provider of technology-enabled language, content, and intellectual property services. RWS has growing revenues of over ?750m through a combination of value accretive acquisitions and organic growth. Group finance, led by our Group CFO; Candy Davies, includes diverse teams across the globe operating in functions including business partnering, operational finance, specialist, and group functions. We cover a footprint of over 100 legal entities in 43 different countries worldwide.     It?? a very exciting time to join RWS Finance for an individual who enjoys change and making an impact! As part of the overall RWS business strategy we are making a significant investment in upgrading our financial systems and processes to deliver enhanced reporting and control, more efficient processing enabling great value through enhanced business partnering and decision support.   Job Purpose   The Transition Manager will play a pivotal role in orchestrating the seamless integration of the second phase of transition of 2 of our legacy finance operations into the Global Finance Shared Service Center (GFSSC). With a focus on optimizing processes and aligning with GFSSC standards, the incumbent will lead end-to-end transition activities, ensuring a comprehensive knowledge transfer and hypercare support. The job's purpose is to drive a successful transition, fostering collaboration, mitigating risks, and achieving a smooth migration of financial processes and systems within the stipulated 9-month contract period.  Key Responsibilities   Collaborate with the Service Manager to develop and execute a strategic plan for transitioning legacy businesses into the Global Finance Shared Service Center (GFSSC), with a significant emphasis on Knowledge Transfer and Hypercare.  Lead and coordinate end-to-end transition activities, prioritizing thorough knowledge transfer sessions and hypercare support to ensure a smooth transition period.  Conduct comprehensive assessments of legacy business processes, identifying opportunities for optimization and alignment with GFSSC standards, focusing on knowledge transfer requirements.  Act as a liaison between the legacy businesses, stakeholders, and the GFSSC team, fostering effective communication and collaboration throughout the transition process, with a specific focus on hypercare support.  Develop and maintain detailed transition plans, emphasizing milestones related to knowledge transfer and hypercare, outlining timelines, and resource requirements.  Provide guidance and support to cross-functional teams involved in the transition, ensuring adherence to established standards and best practices, especially in the context of knowledge transfer and hypercare.  Proactively address challenges and mitigate risks associated with the transition, implementing corrective actions as needed, particularly during the hypercare phase.  Collaborate with IT and other relevant departments to ensure the seamless migration of systems and data into the GFSSC environment, with a strong focus on knowledge transfer.  Monitor and report on the progress of the transition, highlighting achievements, challenges, and areas for improvement, with a specific emphasis on knowledge transfer effectiveness and hypercare support.  Facilitate extensive training sessions and workshops to ensure a comprehensive knowledge transfer and effective hypercare support, ensuring the successful adoption of new processes within the GFSSC.  Skills & Experience   Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business Administration, or related field.  Proven experience in managing transitions within a finance or shared service center environment, with a strong focus on knowledge transfer and hypercare.  Strong understanding of global finance processes, systems, and best practices.  Excellent project management and organizational skills with a keen attention to detail.  Effective communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with diverse stakeholders, especially during knowledge transfer and hypercare phases.  Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.  Problem-solving mindset with the ability to navigate complex challenges.  Proficient in Microsoft Office suite (particularly excel and powerpoint) and project management tools.  Beneficial to have:  Experience with MS Dynamics  Conversant in other languages besides English

Manage a team of 15+ Partner resources in a CoE model, including forecasting effort, budget management, demand pipeline management, Project Delivery leadership and Quality of Delivery.        Proactively gives technical and strategic feedback on projects relevant to their expertise that leads to better outcomes.                    Why you          Basic Qualifications:            17+ years of relevant experience in SAP consulting with deep expertise in SAP BFC, BPC, Group Reporting and Planning modules.          10+ years of relevant experience in IT Project management with specific focus on managing outsourced Tech Partner teams in delivering SAP Finance Projects, with expertise in Project Delivery Methodologies like Agile & Waterfall.          Experience in designing, configuring and deploying complex SAP FICO Projects, including solution build, configuration, testing and delivery to meet business requirements.          Certifications in SAP FICO in SAP ECC 6.0 and / or SAP S/4 HANA, SAP BFC , SAP BPC, SAP BW-IP.            Preferred Qualifications:            Can effectively manage relationships across the Business Community and IT Partner based delivery teams.          Can clearly and confidently articulate risk of technical problems to non technical stakeholders (e.g legal, compliance)          Communicates effectively when representing CoE to external stakeholders (e.g auditors, regulators, third-parties, or industry groups) when appropriate          Can effectively track, manage and address issues in delivery of projects in scope to ensure delivery meets time, cost and quality criteria.          Actively and regularly offers well considered contributions to the roadmap of their team or business area.    Fosters effective collaboration between product,business and operations team.

column2: Coordinates, completes, and oversees job-related activities and assignments by developing and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders; supporting plans and initiatives to meet customer and business needs; identifying and communicating goals and objectives; building accountability for and measuring progress in achieving results; identifying and addressing improvement opportunities; and demonstrating adaptability and promoting continuous learning      Provides supervision and development opportunities for associates by hiring and training; mentoring; assigning duties; providing recognition; and ensuring diversity awareness      Ensures compliance with company policies and procedures and supports company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity by implementing related action plans; utilizing and supporting the Open Door Policy; and providing direction and guidance on applying these in executing business processes and practices                                                                                                  What youll do...                                                                                          Manager Finance (Financial Planning & Analysis)              This position is an    Individual contributor(IC      ) role and is responsible for finance partnering with Segment Finance/ commercial finance teams through financial analysis, budgeting, planning & forecasting; to facilitate decision making and future business strategies        An individual in this position will be expected to perform additional job related responsibilities and duties as assigned and/or necessary              What youll do:              As a member of Walmart s finance organization, you will be responsible for finance business partnering with various Commercial finance teams.              Design and implement forecast and performance management processes to institute rigor, accountability and alignment across business units.              Responsible for providing financial support for planning and control and P&L management, consolidation and reporting of financial results.              Responsibilities will also include modeling, analyzing, and summarizing information into financial plans, operating forecasts on a weekly, monthly, quarterly or annual basis.            Proactively provide view of risks/opportunities and other forward-looking information to mitigate risks.            Prepare and provide recommendations based on analysis performed on various aspects of actual spend vs forecast/plans.              Perform revenue/ expense analysis at cost center level, reconciliation of accounts, variance analysis and ad-hoc analysis as needed.              Ensure that financial operations are fully compliant with regulatory requirements and industry standards. Manage financial risks and take proactive measures to mitigate potential issues.              Collaborate with Walmart Technology, Enterprise Business Solutions and other stakeholders to leverage technology solutions for finance functions, including the implementation and optimization of financial systems and transformational technology such as GenAI.              Ensuring process documentation is always updated and backup plans are in place.              Ensuring all activities are performed on time with utmost accuracy and all key financial metrics/SLAs are tracked and reported as agreed.              Perform administrative activities associated with the planning applications and models.                Stakeholder Management                Provides and supports the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders.              Work independently with senior Finance stakeholders with minimum supervision and support them in delivering business value.              Lead and drive projects as individual contributor with multiple stakeholders.              Collaborate with cross-functional teams, segment and functional finance leaders, and external partners to ensure seamless integration.                    What youll bring:                  6-10 years of relevant experience. CA/CPA/MBA Finance preferred.              Prior FP&A experience and managing overall P&Ls is mandatory; hands-on experience in financial modelling    and analytics would be an advantage.                Experience in working in a matrix organization structure with global stakeholders.              Strong spreadsheet and PowerPoint skills and proficiency in SAP, BI, Essbase, OneStream, Hyperion Planning or similar financial system.              Strong attention to detail, adherence to deadlines, organizational skills, and analytical skills.              Strong written and oral communication skill. Self-starter able to prioritize given responsibilities with minimal supervision.              Experience in automation tools like Power BI, Tableau, Macro, SQL etc. is preferred.              Open to work in overlap shifts ie 1-10pm or 2-11pm IST.

column2: We are seeking a highly qualified and experienced Associate Director of Finance to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in financial planning and analysis, accounting, receivable management, and budgeting.  The Associate Director of Finance will be responsible for ensuring accurate financial reporting, driving process improvements, and providing strategic insights to support decision-making. Responsibilities: - Track and report on accounts receivable, ensuring timely collections and following up on outstanding payments. - Oversee accounting processes, including revenue recognition and adherence to financial regulations. - Prepare management reports and provide analysis on financial performance, key metrics, and trends. - Collaborate with senior management to prepare financial presentations for board meetings. - Lead the annual operating plan (AOP) preparation, budgeting, forecasting, and target setting. - Address investor queries and provide necessary financial information and analysis. - Work closely with Sales, CRM, and Tech teams to analyze variances and identify areas for improvement. - Streamline financial processes and implement controls to ensure accuracy and compliance. - Lead or contribute to automation projects, such as implementing finance software tools like Zoho. Qualifications and Skills: - Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field. Prepare the various MIS and Audit Schedules for the Capex Expenditure Collaborate with internal and external auditors during audits, providing documentation and explanations related to fixed asset transactions and controls. Perform regular reviews and reconciliations of fixed asset accounts, investigating and resolving any discrepancies or issues that arise. Prepare and analyze fixed asset-related reports, including depreciation schedules, capital expenditure forecasts, and variance analyses, to support financial planning and decision- making processes. Provide training and development opportunities for team members to ensure continuous improvement and professional growth. Ensure the Tax audit schedules preparation related to the Assets. column2: As a Business Analyst, you ll use your understanding of financial reporting and accounting processes as you partner closely with our finance teams to support change and global transformation initiatives across automation, business performance management, resilience and compliance.       With great attention to detail and the ability to deal with complex issues and structures, you ll be responsible for process diagnostics, requirement gathering and help conceptualise solutions or improve processes in close partnership with functional and technology teams.       Using your knowledge of project management and similar technology led solution implementations, you ll also help the business uncover new opportunities and implement best practises.       You will also be responsible to support user testing and root cause analysis for ongoing change programs, provide training to the user group and document artefacts as per standard global practices.       Acting as bridge between technology teams and the business to ensure that deliverables are a reflection of the business needs you ll maintain efficient communication with senior management, technology teams and business stakeholders.       Deliver of ad-hoc reporting to key stakeholders as required will also be part of your role.       We re looking for someone with an MBA with 4-9 years of experience from the finance industry who has an understanding of financial reporting and accounting processes such as period end close processes, month end checks and general ledger hygiene activities and other processes supporting financial and tax reporting.       You ll also be well versed with Agile and waterfall methodologies.       Prior knowledge/experience of tax accounting and reporting processes and Power BI would be an advantage.       You should have the ability to engage with senior stakeholders and the self-confidence to work independently.       Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are also vital for this role along with strong MS Office skills, particularly Excel and PowerPoint.

organization and contributing to its overall success      Working closely with the leadership team, you will provide financial insights, make data-driven recommendations, ensure compliance, and play a critical role in decision-making processes          Requirements              * Chartered Accountant with 3-8 years of Post- Qualification Experience      * Experience with Startups is preferred      * Proficient in MS Office applications, especially in MS excel      * Good analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to handle team and client discussion              Key Responsibilities        * Preparation and finalization of financial statements (monthly, annual), for group reporting, statutory audit, and tax audit.      * Responsible for all financial transactions of Accounts Payable, Accounts receivable, Vendor payments, Invoicing, Fixed assets management, Treasury, ensuring documentation of the standard operating procedures and responsibility matrix.      * Setting up and automation of processes relating to payments, revenue and reporting      * Functional guidance to Business units and functions and support Business unit on new business models, expansion plans, new service verticals      * Establishing framework of Internal controls over financial reports, and coordinating with US team on Risk and compliance of the US entity              Need to have              * Strong financial acumen, with the ability to interpret and analyze complex financial data and trends.      * Demonstrated leadership and people management skills, with a track record of building and motivating high-performing finance teams.      * Excellent communication and presentation abilities, capable of effectively conveying financial insights to non-financial stakeholders.      * practices.              Nice to have              * An unabashed desire to work with A players and an unwillingness to compromise      * Ability to build trust with the team members      * Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and high growth business environment

column1: Deputy Manager- Finance and Administration Delivery
column2: The Finance & Admin Business Analyst is essential to the ongoing profitable operations for one of the most globally recognized and respected companies in the world. By overseeing our financial activities, you will enable IBM to continue to bring to market ground-breaking innovations such as Artificial Intelligence, Cognitive Solutions, Cloud Infrastructure, and Blockchain technologies, to name a few. Your Role and Responsibilities As Professional (Lead)- Order to Cash (O2C), you are responsible for processing Accounts Receivable - posting and balancing of daily cash applications, preparing journal entries, filing of records, general account reconciliations. You should be flexible to work in shifts.  Responsibilities Analysis of receivable accounts, investigation of entries, and pulling audit prep work.  Involve in netting instructions, direct Debit run, rejection of Direct Debit and Oracle updating. Investigate unapplied payments, rectify and ensure proper allocation. Provide information relating to customer payments, refunds and other miscellaneous accounts receivables questions Ensure that client Service Level Agreements (SLA) and timelines are met Required Technical and Professional Expertise Commerce Graduate with minimum 6+ years of Experience in Order to Cash (O2C) basic accounting knowledge and understanding of various accounting principles. Experience in participating and collaborating in team meetings to gather/share information Ability to achieve individual and Business metrics Demonstrated experience in meeting all baseline and project goals for accuracy and timeliness. Hands-on expertise to increase cash application automation, increase touchless cash settlement, and reduce cash application complexity and instability across accounts assigned. Prior experience in monitoring customer account statuses and results regarding cash application against defined critical metrics, goals and objectives. Proven experience to build and utilize reports to analyze pertinent account information. Experience in collaboration and negotiation with customers, sales field, and finance functions to achieve improvements. Working knowledge to identify and implement action plans and process improvements with mentorship. Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Proficient in MS office applications and any ERP software as end user Ambitious individual who can work under their own direction towards agreed targets/goals.  Ability to work under tight timelines and have been part of change management initiatives. Proven interpersonal skills while contributing to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Enhance technical skills by attending educational workshops, reviewing publications etc.

column2: Drives the execution of multiple business plans and projects by identifying customer and operational needs; developing and communicating business plans and priorities; removing barriers and obstacles that impact performance; providing resources; identifying performance standards; measuring progress and adjusting performance accordingly; developing contingency plans; and demonstrating adaptability and supporting continuous learning      Provides supervision and development opportunities for associates by selecting and training; mentoring; assigning duties; building a team-based work environment; establishing performance expectations and conducting regular performance evaluations; providing recognition and rewards; coaching for success and improvement; and ensuring diversity awareness      Promotes and supports company policies, procedures, mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity by training and providing direction to others in their use and application; ensuring compliance with them; and utilizing and supporting the Open Door Policy      Ensures business needs are being met by evaluating the ongoing effectiveness of current plans, programs, and initiatives; consulting with business partners, managers, co-workers, or other key stakeholders; soliciting, evaluating, and applying suggestions for improving efficiency and cost-effectiveness; and participating in and supporting community outreach events                  Key Responsibilities:            As a member of Walmart s finance organization, you will be responsible for finance business partnering with various Commercial finance teams.          Design, lead and implement forecast and performance management processes to institute rigor, accountability and alignment across business units.          Responsible for providing financial support for planning and control and P&L management, consolidation and reporting of financial results.          Responsibilities will also include gathering, modeling, analyzing, and summarizing information into financial plans, operating forecasts on a weekly, monthly, quarterly or annual basis.          Proactively provide view of risks/opportunities and other forward-looking information to mitigate risks.          Prepare and provide recommendations based on analysis performed on various aspects of actual spend vs forecast/plans.          Perform revenue/ expense analysis at cost center level, reconciliation of accounts, variance analysis and ad-hoc analysis as needed.          Ensure that financial operations are fully compliant with regulatory requirements and industry standards. Manage financial risks and take proactive measures to mitigate potential issues.          Collaborate with Walmart Technology, Enterprise Business Solutions and other stakeholders to leverage technology solutions for finance functions, including the implementation and optimization of financial systems and transformational technology such as GenAI.          Ensuring process documentation is always updated and backup plans are in place.          Ensuring all activities are performed on time with utmost accuracy and all key Financial metrics/SLAs are tracked and reported as agreed.          Provides supervision and development opportunities for associates by hiring and training; performance management, mentoring; assigning duties; providing recognition; and ensuring diversity awareness.            Stakeholder Management            Provides and supports the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders.          Work independently with senior Finance stakeholders with minimum supervision and support them in delivering business value.          Lead and drive projects as individual contributor or people manager with multiple stakeholders.          Collaborate with cross-functional teams, segment and functional finance leaders, and external partners to ensure seamless integration.                  What youll bring:            14-20 years of relevant experience. CA/CWA/CPA/MBA Finance preferred.          Prior FP&A experience and managing overall P&Ls is mandatory; hands-on experience in financial modelling and analytics would be an advantage.          Prior experience in leading teams, driving improvements and transformation.          Experience in working in a matrix organization structure with global stakeholders in multiple time zones.          Strong spreadsheet and PowerPoint skills and proficiency in SAP, BI, Essbase, OneStream, Hyperion Planning or similar financial system.          Strong attention to detail, adherence to deadlines, organizational skills, and analytical skills.          Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Self-starter able to prioritize given responsibilities with minimal supervision.          Experience in automation tools like Power BI, Tableau, Macro, SQL etc. is preferred          Open to work in overlap shifts ie 1-10pm or 2-11pm IST
column11: Data analysis, Change management, Financial analysis, Consulting, Financial planning, Budgeting, Business intelligence, Financial modelling, Forecasting, Analytics

Design, lead and implement forecast and performance management processes to institute rigor, accountability and alignment across business units.          Responsible for providing financial support for planning and control and P&L management, consolidation and reporting of financial results.          Responsibilities will also include gathering, modeling, analyzing, and summarizing information into financial plans, operating forecasts on a weekly, monthly, quarterly or annual basis.          Proactively provide view of risks/opportunities and other forward-looking information to mitigate risks.          Prepare and provide recommendations based on analysis performed on various aspects of actual spend vs forecast/plans.          Perform revenue/ expense analysis at cost center level, reconciliation of accounts, variance analysis and ad-hoc analysis as needed.          Ensure that financial operations are fully compliant with regulatory requirements and industry standards. Manage financial risks and take proactive measures to mitigate potential issues.          Collaborate with Walmart Technology, Enterprise Business Solutions and other stakeholders to leverage technology solutions for finance functions, including the implementation and optimization of financial systems and transformational technology such as GenAI.          Ensuring process documentation is always updated and backup plans are in place.          Ensuring all activities are performed on time with utmost accuracy and all key Financial metrics/SLAs are tracked and reported as agreed.          Provides supervision and development opportunities for associates by hiring and training; performance management, mentoring; assigning duties; providing recognition; and ensuring diversity awareness.            Stakeholder Management            Provides and supports the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders.          Work independently with senior Finance stakeholders with minimum supervision and support them in delivering business value.          Lead and drive projects as individual contributor or people manager with multiple stakeholders.          Collaborate with cross-functional teams, segment and functional finance leaders, and external partners to ensure seamless integration.            Competencies          Judgment:    Demonstrate Professional Judgment - Researches and integrates relevant information and data, and uses expertise to make recommendations or decisions. Identifies and applies sound, fact-based criteria in setting priorities and making decisions. Uses business measures and analyses to identify improvement opportunities. Probes and looks beyond symptoms to determine the root causes of problems and identify possible solutions.        Customer Centered:    Meet Internal and External Customer Needs - Identifies the requirements, expectations, and needs of Customers. Supports and aligns with initiatives, goals, and actions focused on improving Customer service. Addresses the concerns and issues of internal and external Customers. Uses Customer data, analyses and provides insights to improve Customer-related decisions.        Team Player:    Excellent team player and able to collaborate across different teams and geographies, Support teams in case of BCP requirements.        Execution and Results:    Focus on Execution and Results - Aligns and pursues work activities to achieve the mission and business priorities of the organization. Shares information, practices and resources across functions, organizations, and locations to improve performance. Effectively uses existing processes and tools to achieve performance objectives. Uses and explains major process steps to manage time, resources and challenges to meet goals.        Planning and Improvement:    Plan for and Improve Performance - Develops and implements plans, practices, and processes to better achieve organizational goals. Develops contingency plans to manage or eliminate potential problems. Identifies and recommends ways to continually improve and streamline processes and practices.        Influence and Communicate:    Build Influence - Develops and presents logical, convincing reasons in support of one s perspectives and initiatives. Proactively shares relevant information and timely updates with appropriate people. Listens attentively and asks questions to ensure understanding. Researches information for and prepares documents and presentations that effectively convey relevant information in a timely manner.        Ethics and Compliance:    Model Ethics and Compliance - Acts in accordance with policies and procedures. Demonstrates ethical performance. Supports efforts to enforce compliance with policies and procedures.        Adaptability:    Adapt Professionally - Demonstrates creativity and strength in the face of change, obstacles, and adversity. Adapts to competing demands and shifting priorities. Updates and shares knowledge and skills to keep current in one s area of expertise. Embraces change and supports its implementation.        Build Relationships:    Form Relationships - Builds trusting, collaborative relationships and alliances across functional and organizational boundaries. Relates to others in an accepting and respectful manner, regardless of their organizational level, personality, or background. Collaborates with people from diverse backgrounds, experiences, and functional areas to discover new perspectives.        Change Management :    Support and lead change initiatives within the Finance Center of Excellence and work with team during transformation        What you'll bring:            10-14 years of relevant experience. CA/CWA/CPA/MBA Finance preferred.          Prior FP&A experience and managing overall P&Ls is mandatory; hands-on experience in financial modelling and analytics would be an advantage.          Prior experience in leading teams, driving improvements and transformation.          Experience in working in a matrix organization structure with global stakeholders in multiple time zones.          Strong spreadsheet and PowerPoint skills and proficiency in SAP, BI, Essbase, OneStream, Hyperion Planning or similar financial system.          Strong attention to detail, adherence to deadlines, organizational skills, and analytical skills.          Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Self-starter able to prioritize given responsibilities with minimal supervision.          Experience in automation tools like Power BI, Tableau, Macro, SQL etc. is preferred          Open to work in overlap shifts ie 1-10pm or 2-11pm IST                                                                                                                                                                                                    Minimum Qualifications                                                                                                        Minimum Qualifications:Bachelors degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field and 3 years experience in accounting, finance, or relevant area OR 5 years experience in accounting, finance, or related area. 1 years experience leading and completing cross-functional projects.
