column1: Deputy Manager - Finance (Appraisals and Repayments Collection)
column2: We are actively seeking a dynamic and innovative individual to join our finance team as a Deputy Finance Manager, specializing in Appraisals and Repayments for applicants with no or limited credit history       The successful candidate will play a crucial role in assessing and managing the financial viability of individuals who may not have an extensive credit background     This position requires a creative approach to financial appraisals, a keen understanding of risk mitigation, and effective collaboration with Microfinance Institutions (MFIs), Banks, and Non-Banking Financial Companies (NBFCs)                    Responsibilities                       Onboarding and Capacity building of Field Agents:                     Identification, due-diligence and on boarding of field agents (Kiosks/udyaME saathis) as per the set SOPs.                      Drafting and finalization of contracts of the field agents.                     Orientation and capacity building of Field agents upon onboarding                     Managing the field agents and ensuring that targets are met by the field agents.                     Performance appraisal of the field agents                     Financial Appraisals for No/Limited Credit Applicants:                     Develop specialized financial appraisal methods for individuals with no or limited credit history.                     Implement alternative creditworthiness assessments, considering unconventional data sources and indicators.                     Evaluate the potential risks and benefits associated with lending to applicants with non-traditional credit profiles.                     Repayment Solutions:                     Coordinate with field agents and ensure repayment of dues before the deadline                      Continuously monitor and track the repayment data provided by MFI/NBFC/Bank Partners                     Proactively sort and prioritize and identify high risk loan defaulters                     Implement SOPs in case of non repayment through field agents.                     Continuously monitor and adapt repayment strategies based on individual financial progress.                     Liaison with MFIs, Banks, and NBFCs:                     Establish and foster relationships with Microfinance Institutions, Banks, and Non-Banking Financial Companies that specialize in serving individuals with limited credit history.                     Collaborate with external partners to explore innovative financial products and services catering to this specific segment.                     Risk Mitigation:                     Develop and implement risk mitigation strategies that are adaptive to the challenges posed by applicants with no or limited credit history.                     Stay informed about emerging trends and technologies in alternative credit scoring.                     Education and Empowerment:                     Conduct financial literacy programs to empower applicants with the necessary knowledge to improve their creditworthiness.                     Provide guidance on building and establishing a positive credit history.                     Reporting and Documentation:                     Maintain accurate documentation of alternative credit assessments and repayment plans.                     Generate reports highlighting the success and challenges of lending to individuals with no or limited credit history.                     Location :    Delhi with extensive travel in UP                    Qualifications:                     Bachelors degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or a related field. Masters degree or relevant certifications is advantageous.                     Proven experience in financial management, particularly in designing solutions for individuals with no or limited credit history.                     Innovative thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to adapt to non-traditional credit evaluation methods.                     Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively with diverse audiences.                     Familiarity with technology-driven solutions for assessing creditworthiness is a plus.                     Ability to work collaboratively in a team and independently when required.                     Compassion and commitment to financial inclusion and empowerment.                     If you are a finance professional with a passion for inclusive finance and possess the creativity to design solutions for individuals with no or limited credit history, we invite you to apply for this impactful role. Submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and approach to addressing the challenges associated with this specific segment.

column2: Job Description       As the Finance Manager,  you will be responsible for overseeing all financial aspects of the pre-opening phase of Fairmont Mumbai,  including budgeting,  forecasting,  financial planning and analysis,  and internal controls.  You will play a key role in ensuring the financial success and sustainability of the hotel by providing strategic financial guidance and implementing sound financial practices.       Key Responsibilities:          Financial Planning and Analysis:   Develop,  implement,  and manage comprehensive financial plans,  budgets,  and forecasts for the pre-opening phase,  in alignment with corporate objectives and industry standards.       Financial Reporting:   Prepare accurate and timely financial reports,  including monthly financial statements,  variance analysis,  and key performance indicators (KPIs),  to senior management and corporate headquarters.       Cash Flow Management:   Monitor cash flow projections and liquidity requirements,  optimize cash resources,  and implement cash management strategies to ensure adequate funding for pre-opening activities and ongoing operations.       Cost Control:   Implement cost control measures and monitor expenses to ensure adherence to budgetary constraints and maximize profitability while maintaining high-quality standards.       Internal Controls:   Establish and maintain robust internal controls and financial procedures to safeguard assets,  prevent fraud,  and ensure compliance with company policies,  accounting standards,  and regulatory requirements.       Financial Risk Management:   Identify,  assess,  and mitigate financial risks associated with pre-opening activities,  including market risks,  currency risks,  and operational risks,  through proactive risk management strategies.       Capital Expenditure Management:   Manage capital expenditure projects,  evaluate investment opportunities,  and coordinate with project teams to ensure cost-effective allocation of resources and timely completion of projects.       Financial Strategy Development:   Develop and recommend financial strategies and initiatives to drive revenue growth,  cost optimization,  and operational efficiency,  in collaboration with cross-functional teams.       Team Leadership:   Lead and mentor the finance team members,  providing guidance,  coaching,  and support to foster their professional development and ensure high performance.         Qualifications        Bachelor's degree in Finance,  Accounting,  Business Administration,  or related field; Master's degree or professional certification (e. g. ,  CPA,  CFA) preferred.     Minimum of 7 years of progressive experience in finance and accounting roles,  preferably in the hospitality industry or a related field,  with at least 3 years in a managerial capacity.     Strong financial acumen with a deep understanding of financial principles,  practices,  and regulations.     Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret financial data,  analyze trends,  and develop actionable insights.     Proficiency in financial modeling,  budgeting,  forecasting,  and financial software (e. g. ,  SAP,  Oracle).     Strong leadership and team management skills,  with the ability to motivate and inspire team members to achieve organizational goals.     Excellent communication,  presentation,  and interpersonal skills,  with the ability to interact effectively with senior management,  stakeholders,  and external partners.         Additional Information          Our commitment to Diversity & Inclusion  :      We are an inclusive company,  and our ambition is to attract,  recruit and promote diverse talent.

column1: Customer Finance Manager - Medical Equipment Financing
column2: Profile Overview: The Customer Finance Manager for medical equipment financing plays a crucial role in enabling healthcare providers to acquire the necessary medical equipment through tailored financial solutions. This position involves managing financial relationships with customers, developing financing plans that meet both the customer's needs and the company's financial goals, and ensuring compliance with financial regulations. Here's a detailed job description for this role: The Customer Finance Manager is responsible for leading and managing all aspects of financing solutions for customers purchasing medical equipment. This role involves analyzing financial data, developing customized financing plans, managing risk, and ensuring a high level of customer satisfaction throughout the financing process. The position requires a blend of financial acumen, customer service skills, and an understanding of the medical equipment industry. Job Description / Responsibilities: Financing Solution Development: Design and implement innovative financing solutions tailored to the needs of healthcare providers purchasing medical equipment. This includes loans, leases, and other financing structures. Financial Analysis and Risk Assessment: Conduct thorough financial analyses of customers' financial statements and credit histories to assess creditworthiness and determine appropriate financing terms. Customer Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with healthcare providers, offering expert financial advice and support throughout the purchase process. Compliance and Regulatory Adherence: Ensure all financing agreements and practices comply with applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards. Stay updated on changes in financial regulations that may impact medical equipment financing. Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with sales, marketing, and product teams to align financing solutions with sales strategies and customer needs. Support sales efforts by providing financial expertise and solutions that facilitate equipment sales. Portfolio Management: Oversee the management of the financing portfolio, including monitoring of payments, managing defaults, and handling restructuring or recovery actions when necessary. Market Analysis: Analyze market trends and competitor financing offerings to ensure the company's financing solutions remain competitive and meet the evolving needs of healthcare providers. Reporting and Performance Tracking: Develop and maintain reports on financing activities, portfolio performance, and customer feedback to inform strategic decisions and improve service offerings. Desired Profile: Bachelors degree in Finance, Business Administration, or a related field. An MBA or professional certification in finance (e.g., CFA, CPA) is preferred. Proven experience in financial services, banking, or a related field, with specific experience in equipment financing or healthcare financing highly desirable. Strong understanding of financial concepts, credit analysis, and risk management principles. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships with customers and internal teams. Proficiency in financial modeling and analysis software. Knowledge of the medical equipment industry and healthcare market trends is a plus. Skills Required Financial analysis and risk assessment Customer service and relationship management Strategic thinking and problem-solving Compliance and regulatory knowledge Collaboration and teamwork Effective communication and negotiation

column1: Sr. Manager - Fin Reporting & Tech Accounting
column2: Sr. Manager- Financial reporting & Technical accounting would be responsible for financial assistance for all the International Entities (20+ and growing) of UKG spread across APAC, EMEA and North America. This position will be based out of UKGs Noida office in India and will report to the Director Finance who is also based out of same office. Further, this position will operate during 11:30am IST to 8:30pm IST. How You Can Be the Impact  The role is expected to act as a regional Finance controller for international entities of UKG with following key deliverables: Review of standalone financial statements for approx. 20 Intl entities in EMEA and APAC region (including India) and highlight any major deviation/inconsistency to the management beforehand ensuring no surprise culture. Collaborate with Corporate Teams & External consultants for preparation & filing of Company Financials & other compliances. Facilitation of Audits for all international entities and arranging all the inputs required by auditors with the help of global finance teams spread across various countries. Ensuring strong relationship with the statutory auditors and the group auditors for the purpose of finalization of statutory audit within stringent timelines, ensuring clean audit reports, negotiation of fees etc. Preparing technical accounting memos, providing guidance to the global finance team on accounting and conducting knowledge sessions. Releasing Periodic dashboards to the senior management apprising about the audit progress, challenges, and any technical matter. Drive the internal control and ICFR/Sox audit of the assigned entities. Hands-on experience of Direct and Indirect tax compliances and litigations like Transfer Pricing, Master filing, Income taxes, GST, Service tax etc. Understand the complex and fast-changing regulatory landscape, take the lead to ensure the regulatory and new compliances are well taken care of. Lead the process to provide quality assurance for the financials of the entities along with Providing financial advisory to the leadership. Help drive process improvement initiatives by applying strong communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills. Participate in process automation ideas & AI/BOT implementation by suggesting efficient methodologies and collaborate with respective team for successful implementation. Manage the performance of the financial reporting & Technical accounting team, manage necessary coaching and trainings to develop the team Dynamic leader who can recruit, develop and retain a healthy talent pool. To be the finance business partner to Global finance leadership teams and support corporate controller based out of US. To provide governance and controllership assurance to the business.  Qualifications CA/CPA with minimum 12-15 years of financial reporting experience in US GAAP, general ledger accounting and IFRS. Expert knowledge of US GAAP and Local STAT GAAP (IFRS & IND AS). Hands-on experience of General Ledger accounting in Microsoft Dynamics D365 framework is preferred. Strong understanding of Direct and Indirect tax compliances and litigations like Transfer Pricing, Master filing, Income taxes, GST, Service tax etc. Well versed with the other related compliances prevalent (ESG, Payment time reporting, MSME, FEMA, MCA, DGFT etc). Highly skilled in communication, developing & mentoring direct and indirect teams. Well-organized, extreme attention to detail and a self-directed individual Tech Savvy with AI knowledge experience is plus. Prior experience working with a US multinational company would be an added advantage.

column2: Aster Medcity  is looking for Assistant Manager Finance & Accounts  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    An Assistant Manager in Finance and Accounts is a role that involves supporting the financial operations and activities of an organization     They work closely with the finance and accounting team to ensure accurate financial records, compliance with regulations, and efficient financial management       Here are the key responsibilities of an Assistant Manager in Finance and Accounts:       Financial Reporting: Assistant Managers in Finance and Accounts contribute to the preparation and analysis of financial statements, including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements     They ensure compliance with accounting principles, standards, and regulatory requirements (such as Generally Accepted Accounting Principles or International Financial Reporting Standards)     Budgeting and Forecasting: They assist in the budgeting process by providing financial data, analyzing trends, and participating in budget discussions     They help develop financial forecasts, monitor actual performance against budgets, and provide insights to support decision-making     Financial Analysis: Assistant Managers perform financial analysis to assess the organization's financial performance and identify areas for improvement     They analyze financial data, ratios, and key performance indicators (KPIs), and provide recommendations to enhance financial efficiency, profitability, and cost control     Internal Controls and Compliance: They assist in implementing and maintaining internal control procedures to safeguard assets, prevent fraud, and ensure compliance with financial regulations     They participate in internal audits, identify control weaknesses, and recommend improvements to mitigate risks     Accounts Payable and Receivable: Assistant Managers oversee accounts payable and receivable processes     They ensure timely and accurate processing of invoices, monitor payment collections, manage vendor relationships, and reconcile accounts to maintain accurate financial records     Financial Planning and Analysis: They support financial planning and analysis activities, such as variance analysis, financial modeling, and scenario planning     They assist in assessing investment opportunities, evaluating financial risks, and developing financial strategies to support organizational goals     Taxation and Compliance: Assistant Managers collaborate with tax professionals or external consultants to ensure compliance with tax laws and regulations     They assist in preparing tax returns, coordinating tax audits, and providing relevant financial data for tax planning purposes     Treasury Management: They assist in cash flow management, including monitoring cash positions, forecasting cash needs, and optimizing working capital     They may coordinate with banks, manage bank accounts, and assist in cash flow projections     Financial Systems and Processes: Assistant Managers contribute to the improvement and implementation of financial systems and processes     They may assist in implementing accounting software, enhancing financial reporting capabilities, and streamlining financial workflows     Team Management and Development: They may provide guidance and support to junior members of the finance and accounts team, assign tasks, and ensure efficient teamwork     They may also assist in training and developing team members' skills to enhance overall performance
